messages.title: Jobs, Equality, and Sustainability for Bristol West
messages.content: Since the last election, I have been out almost every day in Bristol West talking to voters about the impact of government policies. People are suffering under the Bedroom Tax, struggling in exploitative zero hours contracts, and watching the NHS being sold to their eyes. Bristol's Lib Dem MP voted for all these things, as well as for tax breaks for the rich.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting Bedroom Tax and Exploitative Contracts
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Addressing the Bedroom Tax and exploitative zero hours contracts negatively impacting constituents.
Opposing the sale of the NHS and supporting policies to improve healthcare.
Challenging policies that give tax breaks to the rich and ensuring a fair tax system.

mentions.candidate: Since the last election, I have been out almost every day in Bristol West talking to voters about the impact of this governmentâ€™s policies.
mentions.tacticalSituation: On May 7th we'll decide whether or not to keep a Tory/Lib Dem government.

issues.economy: Struggling in exploitative zero hours contracts, and watching the NHS being sold to their eyes
issues.education: We introduced Sure Start centres, the minimum wage and the Education Maintenance Allowance which helped 16 and 17 year olds stay at school.
issues.health: People are suffering...watching the NHS being sold to their eyes.
issues.socialWelfare: People are suffering under the Bedroom Tax

housing.content: People are suffering under the Bedroom Tax

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm writing to you because I understand you've talked to a Labour volunteer and told them that, on balance, you would prefer a Labour government to a Tory government on May 7th.

images.caption: Thangam Debbonaire's campaign leaflet cover page.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet focuses on challenges faced by constituents under the current government, and how the candidate wants to address these issues, such as the Bedroom Tax, exploitative employment contracts, and the state of the NHS.
